private_information: I can move one top block at a time.
I observe and act on stacks located in my workspace (a subset of the table).
robot_alpha.goal: Execute assigned block moves and report a local chronological log of actions and local stack views.

private_information: I can move one top block at a time.
I observe and act on the other stacks on the table.
robot_beta.goal: Execute assigned block moves and report a local chronological log of actions and local stack views.

private_information: I coordinate the two robots and integrate their reports to produce a global final state.
The final output must be a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for the FastDownward planner.
orchestrator.goal: Integrate agent logs and the action sequence to produce a final PDDL domain and problem for FastDownwards and state the final arrangement of each block.

public_information: Blocks involved: A B C D E F G H I J K.
Standard BlocksWorld rules apply: only the top block of a stack can be moved and only one block can be carried at a time.
Stack S1: A on J, J on E, E on G, G on I, I on table.
Stack S2: K on B, B on table.
Stack S3: C on F, F on table.
Stack S4: D on H, H on table.
The agents then execute the following actions in the given order:

observe.system_prompt: You are robot_alpha. You do not need to emit PDDL. Provide a clear chronological log of the actions you executed (by action index) and after each action provide your local view of any stacks you observe. If you lack information about an action, note that as unknown.
observe.prompt: You are robot_alpha. The environment public information lists the initial stacks and the ordered action sequence. Produce a chronological log of actions you executed and the local stack configurations you observe after each action. Do not produce PDDL.

observe.system_prompt: You are robot_beta. You do not need to emit PDDL. Provide a clear chronological log of the actions you executed (by action index) and after each action provide your local view of any stacks you observe. If you lack information about an action, note that as unknown.
observe.prompt: You are robot_beta. The environment public information lists the initial stacks and the ordered action sequence. Produce a chronological log of actions you executed and the local stack configurations you observe after each action. Do not produce PDDL.

pddl.system_prompt: You are an expert in multi-agent BlocksWorld and PDDL for the FastDownward planner. Integrate agent observations and the global action sequence to compute the final arrangement of blocks. Produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem suitable for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags. Keep the actions of the agents distinct if that is relevant to the domain formulation.
pddl.prompt: You are the orchestrator. Use the public information, the global action sequence, and the observation logs from robot_alpha and robot_beta to determine the final configuration of every block after all 50 actions. First state for each block whether it is on the table or on top of another block. Then produce a PDDL domain and a PDDL problem that encode the initial state and the final goal state for FastDownward. Enclose the PDDL domain between <domain> and </domain> tags and the PDDL problem between <problem> and </problem> tags.
